titleStmt.title: At St. James's the 7th of January, by His Highness the Prince of Orange My Lords and gentlemen, the only reason which induced me to undergo so dangerous an undertaking, ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1689-1694 : William and Mary)
William III, King of England, 1650-1702.

notesStmt.note: At end of text: Given at St. Jame's this eighth day of January 1688/9.
Title from caption title and first lines of text.
A speech to the Scots Lords, followed by their address.
Torn with some loss of print.
Reproduction of the original in the Harvard University Library.
